page.title: 03TRUSTS AND FOOTPATHS
page.content: The Pilgrim Trust and the Oxford Preservation Trust have protected the views over Otmoor from the village of Elsfield.In Woodeaton the O.P.T. have built 13 houses in keeping with their surroundings. Woodeaton was a recognised community in Anglo-Saxon times.The present manor house, now a special school,dates from 1770. Bridleways (signed) exist between Woodeaton and Elsfield and there is one between Prattle Wood and Noke. These are deeply rutted and muddy to walk along in bad weather. Footpaths run by woods, cornfields, over meadows and by the river. These are sometimes overgrown and difficult to follow. Bridges over streams are intact. The Oxfordshire Way, running from Islip to Noke, and the footpaths are well signed.
